PlainText.PlainText: Okay. Take her up and over the bow rail.
Okay, Mir 2, we're going over the bow. Stay with us.
Seeing her coming out of the darkness like a ghost ship...
To see the sad ruin of the great ship sitting here...
...where she landed at 2:30 in the morning of April 15, 1912,...
You are so full of shit, boss!
Dive six - here we are again on the deck of Titanic.
The pressure outside is 3 1/2 tons per square inch.
These windows are nine inches thick.
If they go, it's sayonara in two microseconds.
All right. Enough of that bullshit.
Put her down on the roof of the officers' quarters.
We've landed on the grand staircase. You guys set to launch?
Yeah. launching Dunkin now. Go, Charlie.
Okay, Brock, we're dropping down along the hull.
Roger that. Okay, drop down and go into the first-class gangway door.
I want you guys working the ''D'' deck, reception and the dining saloon.
(Brock) Snoop Dog is on the move.
Okay, Lewis. Drop down to ''B'' deck.
I see it. I got it.
- (Lewis) Cable out, Captain. - Make your turn.
Brock, we're at the piano. You copy?
- That's the bedroom door! - I see it... I see it.
That's where the son of a bitch slept.
Hold it. Go back to the right.
- You smelling something, boss? - I wanna see what's under it.
- Take it easy. It might come apart. - Okay.
Flip it over, flip it over. Go.
Oh, baby, baby... Are you seeing this, boss?
- let me get around. Hang on. - You getting it?
...the same thing happened to Geraldo, and his career never recovered.
Brock, the partners would like to know how it's going.
Hey, Dave. Barry. Hi. look, it wasn't in the safe, but hey...
...don't worry about it. There's plenty of places it could be.
The floor debris, the mother's room...
- Purser's safe on ''C'' deck. - Jimmy Hoffa's briefcase.
You've got to trust my instincts. I know we're close.
We just got to go through a process of elimination.
We might have something here, guys.
Where's the photo of the necklace?
- We'll call you right back. - Holy...
(TV) Treasure hunter Brock Lovett is best known for finding Spanish gold...

FormattedText.Content: {(TV) Treasure hunter Brock Lovett is best known for finding Spanish gold... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: It's okay. I'll feed you in a minute.
He's chartered a Russian sub to reach the most famous wreck of all: Titanic.

FormattedText.Content: {He's chartered a Russian sub to reach the most famous wreck of all: Titanic. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: He's with us live via satellite from the Keldysh in the North Atlantic.

FormattedText.Content: {He's with us live via satellite from the Keldysh in the North Atlantic. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}
{-Hello, Brock. -Hello, Tracy. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Everyone knows the stories of Titanic,...

FormattedText.Content: {Everyone knows the stories of Titanic,... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...the nobility, the band playing and all that.

FormattedText.Content: {...the nobility, the band playing and all that. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: I'm interested in the untold stories, the secrets deep inside the hull.

FormattedText.Content: {I'm interested in the untold stories, the secrets deep inside the hull. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: We're using robot technology to go further into the wreck...

FormattedText.Content: {We're using robot technology to go further into the wreck... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}
{...than anybody's ever done before. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: You're at the centre of a controversy...

FormattedText.Content: {You're at the centre of a controversy... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...over salvage rights, and ethics. Many are calling you a grave robber.

FormattedText.Content: {...over salvage rights, and ethics. Many are calling you a grave robber. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Nobody called the recovery of King Tut ''grave robbing''.

FormattedText.Content: {Nobody called the recovery of King Tut ''grave robbing''. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: - What is it? - Turn that up, dear.

FormattedText.Content: {I have museum-trained experts here... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...making sure these relics are treated properly.

FormattedText.Content: {...making sure these relics are treated properly. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: look at this drawing we found just today.

FormattedText.Content: {look at this drawing we found just today. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: A piece of paper that's been underwater for 84 years...

FormattedText.Content: {A piece of paper that's been underwater for 84 years... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...and my team were able to preserve it intact.

FormattedText.Content: {...and my team were able to preserve it intact. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Should this have remained unseen at the bottom of the ocean for eternity?

FormattedText.Content: {Should this have remained unseen at the bottom of the ocean for eternity? Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Brock! There's a satellite call for you.
Bobby, we're launching. You see these submersibles going in?
Trust me, buddy. You wanna take this call.
You gotta speak up. She's kinda old.
This is Brock Lovett. How can I help you, Mrs...?
I was just wondering if you'd found the ''Heart of the Ocean'', Mr. Lovett.
I said you wanted to take the call.
All right. You have my attention, Rose.
Can you tell us who the woman in the picture is?
The woman in the picture is me.
She's a goddamned liar! Some nutcase seeking money or publicity!
God only knows why! like that Russian babe, Anaesthesia!
Rose DeWitt Bukater died on Titanic when she was 17.
If she'd lived, she'd be over 100 by now.
So she's a very old goddamned liar!
I've done the background on this woman...
...back to the '20s when she was working as an actress.
There's your first clue, Sherlock! Her name was Rose Dawson back then.
She marries a guy named Calvert. They move to Cedar Rapids and have kids.
Now Calvert’s dead, and Cedar Rapids, too.
Everybody who knows about the diamond...
...is supposed to be dead or on this boat, but she knows.
Doesn't exactly travel light, does she?
- Are your staterooms all right? - Very nice.
Have you met my granddaughter Lizzy?
We met just a few minutes ago.
Have to have my pictures when I travel.
I would like to see my drawing.
(Brock) Louis XVI wore a fabulous stone, the Blue Diamond of the Crown,...
About that time old Louis lost everything, from the neck up.
The theory goes that the Crown Diamond was chopped, too.
Recut into a heart shape that became known as ''The Heart of the Ocean''.
Today it'd be worth more than the Hope Diamond.
It was a dreadful, heavy thing.
I only wore it this once.
You actually think this is you, Nana?
I tracked it down through insurance records.
An old claim that was settled under terms of absolute secrecy.
Can you tell me who the claimant was, Rose?
The claim was for a necklace his son Caledon bought his fiancée - you -
...a week before he sailed on Titanic.
It was filed right after the sinking,...
...so the diamond had to have gone down with the ship.
If your grandmother is who she says she is,...
...she was wearing the diamond the day the Titanic sank.
And that makes you my new best friend.
These are some of the things we recovered from your stateroom.
And it looks the same as it did the last time I saw it.
The reflection has changed a bit.
Are you ready to go back to Titanic?
Okay, here we go. She hits the berg on the starboard side, right?
She bumps along, punching holes along the side, below the waterline.
Then the forward compartments start to flood.
As the water rises, it spills over the watertight bulkheads...
...which don't go any higher than ''E'' deck.
So now as the bow goes down, the stern rises up,...
...slow at first, then faster and faster,...
...until she's got her whole ass up in the air. A big ass.
The hull's not designed to deal with that pressure, so what happens?
She splits, right down to the keel, and the stern falls back level.
As the bow sinks it pulls the stern vertical...
The stern section bobs there like a cork for a few minutes,...
Two hours and 40 minutes after the collision.
The bow section planes away, landing about half a mile away,...
...going 20, 30 knots when it hits the ocean floor.
Thank you for that fine forensic analysis, Mr. Bodine.
Of course, the experience of it was... somewhat different.
Will you share it with us?
- I'm taking her to rest. - No.
Do you want to hear this or not, Mr. Lovett?
...and I can still smell the fresh paint.
The china had never been used.
The sheets had never been slept in.
Titanic was called ''The Ship of Dreams''.
...this way, please. This queue. Right here.
- Daddy, it's a ship. - You're right.
Why all the fuss? It doesn't look any bigger than the Mauretania.
You can be blasé about some things, Rose, but not about Titanic.
Your daughter is difficult to impress, Ruth.
So this is the ship they say is unsinkable.
God himself could not sink this ship.
Sir, you have to check your baggage through the main terminal.
I put my faith in you, good sir. Now kindly see my man.
All the trunks from that car there,...
- My coat? - I have it, miss.
All third-class passengers queue here for health inspection.
Welcome aboard, ma'am. Welcome to Titanic.
(Rose) It was the ship of dreams -to everyone else.

FormattedText.Content: {(Rose) It was the ship of dreams -to everyone else. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: To me it was a slave ship...

FormattedText.Content: {To me it was a slave ship... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...taking me back to America in chains.

FormattedText.Content: {...taking me back to America in chains. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Outwardly I was everything a well-brought-up girl should be.

FormattedText.Content: {Outwardly I was everything a well-brought-up girl should be. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}
{Inside, I was screaming. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Jack, you are pazzo. You bet everything we have.
When you got nothing, you got nothing to lose.
(Swedish) You moron. I can't believe you bet our tickets.
I'm sorry. You're not gonna see your mom for a long time.
Cos we're going to America! Full house, boys!
Titanic go to America, in five minutes.
We're riding in high style now! We're a couple of swells!
I go to America to be millionario!
- You're pazzo! - Maybe, but I've got the tickets!
Come on, I thought you were fast!
- Have you been through the inspection? - Of course!
Anyway, we don't have lice. We're Americans.
We're the luckiest sons of bitches in the world!
- You know somebody? - That's not the point.
- Goodbye! I'll miss you! - Goodbye! I will never forget you!
Hey, how you doing? Jack. Nice to meet you.
I'm Jack Dawson. Nice to meet you. How you doing?
Who says you get top bunk, huh?
This is your private deck, sir. Would you be requiring anything?
- This one? - No... It had a lot of faces on it.
Would you like all of them out, miss?
Yes... We need a little colour in this room.
Put it in there, in the wardrobe.
God, not those finger paintings again!
The difference between Cal's taste and mine...
...is that I have some. They're fascinating.
like being inside a dream or something.
- What's the artist's name? - Something Picasso.
''Something Picasso''. He won't amount to a thing. Trust me.
- Put the Degas in the bedroom. - At least they were cheap.
(Rose) At Cherbourg, a woman came aboard named Margaret Brown.

FormattedText.Content: {(Rose) At Cherbourg, a woman came aboard named Margaret Brown. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}
{We all called her Molly. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: History would call her ''The Unsinkable Molly Brown''.

FormattedText.Content: {History would call her ''The Unsinkable Molly Brown''. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: I wasn't about to wait all day, sonny. Here, think you can manage?
Her husband had struck gold someplace out west...

FormattedText.Content: {Her husband had struck gold someplace out west... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...and she was what Mother called ''new money''.

FormattedText.Content: {...and she was what Mother called ''new money''. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: By next afternoon we were steaming west from the coast of Ireland...

FormattedText.Content: {By next afternoon we were steaming west from the coast of Ireland... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...with nothing out ahead of us but ocean.

FormattedText.Content: {...with nothing out ahead of us but ocean. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Take her to sea, Mr. Murdoch.
- let’s stretch her legs. - Yes, sir.
- All ahead full, Mr. Moody. - Very good, sir.
let’s stoke them right up! We're going full ahead!
Hey, look, look, look! look, look!
I can see the Statue of liberty already!
I'm the king of the world!
She is the largest moving object ever made by the hand of man...
He envisioned a steamer so grand in scale...
...that its supremacy would never be challenged.
You know I don't like that, Rose.
We’ll both have the Iamb, rare, with very little mint sauce.
You like Iamb, right, sweet pea?
Are you gonna cut her meat for her, too, Cal?
Hey, who thought of the name ''Titanic''? Was it you, Bruce?
I wanted to convey sheer size, and the size means stability,...
Do you know of Dr. Freud, Mr. Ismay?
His ideas about male preoccupation with size might interest you.
- What's gotten into you? - Excuse me.
She's a pistol, Cal. Hope you can handle her.
Well, I may have to start minding what she reads, Mrs. Brown.
Freud... who is he? Is he a passenger?
- Yeah, it's an Irish ship. - Is English, no?
No, it was built in Ireland. 15,000 Irishmen built this ship.
First-class dogs come down here to take a shite.
It lets us know where we rank.
Hi. Do you make any money with your drawings?
Oh, forget it, boyo. You'd as like have angels fly out of your arse...
...as get next to the likes of her.
(Rose) I saw my whole life as if I'd already lived it,...

FormattedText.Content: {(Rose) I saw my whole life as if I'd already lived it,... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...an endless parade of parties and cotillions,...

FormattedText.Content: {...an endless parade of parties and cotillions,... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}
{...yachts and polo matches. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Always the same narrow people, the same mindless chatter.

FormattedText.Content: {Always the same narrow people, the same mindless chatter. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: I felt like I was standing at a great precipice...

FormattedText.Content: {I felt like I was standing at a great precipice... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}
{...with no-one to pull me back. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: No-one who cared, or even noticed.

FormattedText.Content: {No-one who cared, or even noticed. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: - Gimme your hand. I'll pull you back. - No!
Stay where you are. I mean it.
What do you mean, no, I won't?
Don't presume to tell me what I will and will not do.
Well, you would've done it already.
You let go and I'm gonna have to jump in there after you.
Don't be absurd. You'll be killed.
- I'm a good swimmer. - The fall alone would kill you.
It would hurt. I'm not saying it wouldn't.
But I'm more concerned about that water being so cold.
Freezing. Maybe a couple of degrees over.
They have some of the coldest winters.
I grew up there, near Chippewa Falls.
When I was a kid, me and my father went ice fishing...
I know what ice fishing is!
You just seem like, you know, kind of an indoor girl.
I fell through some thin ice.
...water that cold, like right down there,...
...it hits you like a thousand knives stabbing you all over.
At least not about anything but the pain.
Which is why I'm not looking forward to jumping in there after you.
I'm hoping you'll come back over the rail and get me off the hook here.
With all due respect, miss, I'm not the one hanging off the back of a ship.
I'll have to get you to write that down!
- Please help me! - Listen! Listen to me!
I've got you. I won't let go.
Now pull yourself up. Come on!
You stand back! And don't move an inch!
How dare you put your hands on my fiancée!
- look at me, you filth! - Cal...
- What do you think you were doing? - Cal, stop! It was an accident.
I was leaning over and I slipped.
I was leaning far over to see the, uh...
I would have gone overboard, but Mr. Dawson here saved me...
- She wanted to see the propellers! - Women and machinery do not mix.
Was that the way of it?
Yeah. Yeah, that was pretty much it.
The boy's a hero, then. Good for you, son. Well done.
So it's all's well, and, uh...
look at you. You must be freezing. let’s get you inside.
Perhaps a little something for the boy?
Mr. Lovejoy, I think a 20 should do it.
Is that the going rate for saving the woman you love?
Rose is displeased. What to do...
Perhaps you could join us for dinner tomorrow evening...
...to regale our group with... your heroic tale.
Can I, uh... bum a smoke?
The young lady slips so suddenly...
...and you still had time to remove your jacket and your shoes.
I don't pretend to know why.
A reminder of my feelings for you.
It was worn by Louis XVI, and they called it ''le Coeur de la Mer''.
You know, there's nothing I couldn’t give you.
Oh, open your heart to me, Rose.
(Jack) Well, I've been on my own since I was 15, since my folks died.
I had no close kin in that part of the country.
So I left and I haven't been back since.
You could just call me a tumbleweed blowing in the wind.
Well, Rose, we've walked about a mile around this boat deck...
...and chewed over how great the weather's been and how I grew up,...
...but I reckon that's not why you came to talk to me, is it?
I want to thank you for what you did.
Not just for... for pulling me back, but for your discretion.
look, I know what you must be thinking.
What does she know about misery?
No... No, that's not what I was thinking.
I was thinking what could have happened to this girl...
...to make her think she had no way out.
It was everything. It was my whole world...
The inertia of my life... plunging ahead, and me powerless to stop it.
You would’ve gone straight to the bottom.
All of Philadelphia society will be there,...
...and all the while I feel I'm standing in a crowded room...
...screaming at the top of my lungs, and no-one even looks up.
You shouldn’t be asking me this.
It's a simple question. Do you love the guy or not?
- This is not a suitable conversation. - Can't you just answer the question?
This is absurd. You don't know me and I don't know you,...
...and we are not having this conversation.
You are rude and uncouth and... I am leaving now.
Jack... Mr. Dawson, it's been a pleasure.
I sought you out to thank you...
- And you insulted me. - You deserved it.
- I thought you were leaving. - I am.
I don't have to leave. This is my part of the ship.
Well, well, well! Now who's being rude?
What is this stupid thing you're carrying around?
So what are you? An artist or something?
They're, uh... they're very good, actually.
- They didn't like them in old Paris. - Paris?!
You do get around, for a poor...
Well, uh, uh, a person of limited means.
A poor guy. You can say it.
And these were drawn from life?
That's the good thing about Paris.
lots of girls willing to take their clothes off.
Well, she had beautiful hands, you see?
I think you must have had a love affair with her.
She had a good sense of humour, though.
She used to sit at this bar every night...
...wearing all her jewellery, waiting for her long-lost love.
See how her clothes are all moth-eaten?
Well, you have a gift, Jack.
But the purpose of university is to find a suitable husband.
Here comes that vulgar Brown woman.
Quickly, get up before she sits with us.
- I was hoping I'd catch you at tea. - We're awfully sorry you missed it.
The Countess and I were just off to the boat deck.
What a lovely idea. I need to catch up on my gossip.
So you've not yet lit the last four boilers?
I don't see the need. We are making excellent time.
The press knows the size of Titanic.
Now I want them to marvel at her speed.
We must give them something new to print.
Mr. Ismay, I would prefer not to push the engines...
Of course, I'm just a passenger. I leave it to you to decide what's best.
But a glorious end to your final trip if we arrive on Tuesday night...
...and surprise them all. Make the morning papers.
Retire with a bang, eh, EJ?
Well, after that I worked on a squid boat in Monterey.
Then I went to the pier in Santa Monica...
...and started doing portraits there for 10 cents apiece.
Why can't I be like you, Jack? Just head out for the horizon...
Say we'll go there sometime to that pier...
...even if we only just talk about it.
We’ll drink cheap beer. Ride on the roller coaster.
Then we'll ride horses on the beach...
...right in the surf. But like a real cowboy. Not that sidesaddle stuff.
You mean, one leg on each side?
- Can you show me? - Sure. If you like.
- Teach me to ride like a man. - And chew tobacco like a man.
I'll show you how. Come on.
- I couldn’t possibly, Jack. - Watch closely.
You really gotta hawk it back. Use your arms. Arc your neck.
See the range on that thing?
You gotta work on it. Really try and hawk it up and get some body to it.
(Rose) The others were gracious about the man who saved my life...

FormattedText.Content: {(Rose) The others were gracious about the man who saved my life... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...but my mother looked at him like an insect,...

FormattedText.Content: {...but my mother looked at him like an insect,... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}
{...a dangerous insect,... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}
{...which must be squashed quickly. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Sounds like you're a good man to have around in a sticky spot.
Why do they always announce dinner like a damn cavalry charge?
Do you have any idea what you're doing?
Well, you're about to go into the snakepit.
What are you planning to wear?
I was right! You and my son are just about the same size.
You shine up like a new penny!
(Cal) There are several thousand tons of Hockley steel...
Then we'll know who to hold accountable if there's a problem.
- Hello, my dear. - Good evening, Cal.
I saw that in a nickelodeon once and I always wanted to do it.
Well, it's amazing! You could almost pass for a gentleman!
(Ruth) My dear, it's delightful to see you.
What a remarkable voyage this is! Mad, isn't it?
And, um... that's John Jacob Astor, the richest man on the ship.
His little wifey, Madeleine, is my age and in a delicate condition.
See how she's trying to hide it?
And that's Benjamin Guggenheim and his mistress Madame Aubert.
Mrs. Guggenheim is at home with the children.
And over here we have Sir Cosmo and Lucille, Lady Duff-Gordon.
Care to escort a lady to dinner?
Ain't nothin' to it, Jack. They love money,...
...so just pretend like you own a goldmine and you're in the club.
Well, hello, Molly! Nice to see you.
JJ, Madeleine, I'd like you to meet Jack Dawson.
Are you of the Boston Dawsons?
No... the Chippewa Falls Dawsons, actually.
(Rose) He must have been nervous, but he never faltered.

FormattedText.Content: {(Rose) He must have been nervous, but he never faltered. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: They assumed he was one of them.

FormattedText.Content: {They assumed he was one of them. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Heir to a railroad fortune, perhaps.

FormattedText.Content: {Heir to a railroad fortune, perhaps. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: New money, obviously, but still a member of the club.

FormattedText.Content: {New money, obviously, but still a member of the club. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Mother, of course, could always be counted upon.

FormattedText.Content: {Mother, of course, could always be counted upon. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Tell us of the accommodations in steerage, Mr. Dawson.
Mr. Dawson is joining us from the third class.
He was of some assistance to my fiancée last night.
Mr. Dawson is quite a fine artist.
He was kind enough to show me some of his work today.
Rose and I differ somewhat in our definition of fine art.
Not to impugn your work, sir.
(Ismay) She may be mine on paper...
...but in the eyes of God she belongs to Thomas Andrews.
Start from the outside and work your way in.
- He knows every rivet in her. - Your ship is a wonder, Mr. Andrews.
- How do you take your caviar, sir? - No caviar for me, thanks.
And where exactly do you live, Mr. Dawson?
Well, right now my address is the RMS Titanic.
After that I'm on God's good humour.
And how is it you have means to travel?
I work my way from place to place. You know, tramp steamers and such.
But I won my ticket on Titanic here at a lucky hand at poker.
All life is a game of luck.
A real man makes his own luck, Archie. Right, Dawson?
And you find that sort of rootless existence appealing, do you?
I mean... Got everything I need right here with me.
Got air in my lungs and a few sheets of paper.
I love waking up in the morning not knowing what's gonna happen...
...or who I'm gonna meet, where I'm gonna wind up.
The other night I slept under a bridge.
Now I'm on the grandest ship in the world...
I figure life’s a gift and I don't intend on wasting it.
You never know what hand you're gonna get dealt next.
You learn to take life as it comes at you,...
Mr. Brown had no idea I'd hidden the money in the stove!
So he comes home drunk as a pig and he lights a fire!
Next it'll be brandies in the smoking room.
Join me in a brandy, gentlemen?
Now they retreat into a cloud of smoke...
...and congratulate each other on being masters of the universe.
Ladies, thank you for your company.
- May I escort you to the cabin? - No, I'll stay here.
Don't want to stay with the women, do you?
No, thanks. I've gotta be heading back.
Probably best. It'll be all business and politics. Wouldn’t interest you.
But, Dawson... Good of you to come.
Time for me to row with the other slaves.
So you wanna go to a real party?
Is okay I put my hand here?
Come on, guys, let’s go! Ho!
I'm gonna dance with her now, all right?
We have to get a bit closer.
You're still my best girl, Cora.
- I don't know the steps. - Neither do I. Just go with it.
...jurisdiction of the Sherman Act, so my lawyers will argue.
That's what Rockefeller said, but the court is not swallowing it.
You think a first-class girl can't drink?
Two out of three, two out of three.
You think you're big, tough men?
- You all right? - I haven't done that in years!
Go see Maggie, lads. let’s go!
I had hoped you would come to me last night.
Your exertions below decks were no doubt exhausting.
I see you had that undertaker of a manservant follow me. How typical.
You will never behave like that again, Rose. Do you understand?
I'm not a foreman in one of your mills that you can command.
Yes, you are, and my wife!
My wife in practice if not yet by law, so you will honour me.
You will honour me the way a wife is required to.
I will not be made a fool of.
Is this in any way unclear?
- We had a little... accident. - That's all right, Miss Rose.
I'm sorry, Trudy. let me help you.
You're not to see that boy again. Do you understand me?
Oh, stop it, Mother. You’ll give yourself a nosebleed.
Our situation is precarious. You know the money's gone.
Of course I know it's gone.
Your father left us nothing but a legacy of bad debts...
That name is the only card we have to play.
It is a fine match with Hockley.
How can you put this on my shoulders?
Why are you being so selfish?
Do you want to see me working as a seamstress?
To see our fine things sold at auction?
Our memories scattered to the winds!
â™ª Protect them by thy guardian hand...
â™ª ...from every peril on the land.
â™ª O spirit, whom the father sent...
â™ª O wind of heaven, by thy might...
â™ª ...save all who dare the eagle's flight.
â™ªAnd keep them by thy watchful...
- Sir... - I just need to talk to somebody...
You're not supposed to be in here.
- You don't remember me? - No, I don't.
- You’ll have to turn around. - He'll tell you.
Mr. Hockley and Mrs. DeWitt Bukater...
...continue to be appreciative of your assistance.
They asked me to give you this in gratitude.
You hold a third-class ticket. Your presence here is no longer appropriate.
Please, I just wanna speak to Rose...
Gentlemen, please see that Mr. Dawson gets back to where he belongs...
â™ª O hear us when we cry to Thee...
â™ª ...for those in peril on the sea.
- Why two steering wheels? - We only use this near shore.
Sir, another ice warning. This one's from the Noordam.
Oh, not to worry. Quite normal for this time of year.
In fact, we're speeding up. I've just ordered the last boilers lit.
Okay, son, wind it up tight like I showed you.
- Was good, wasn't it? - Quite nice.
I did the sum in my head...
With the number of lifeboats times the capacity you mentioned...
...it seems there are not enough for everyone.
Rose, you miss nothing, do you?
In fact, I put in these new type davits...
...which can take an extra row of boats.
But it was thought by some that the deck would look too cluttered...
Waste of deck space on an unsinkable ship.
I have built you a good ship, strong and true.
She is all the lifeboat you need.
- I need to talk to you. - No, Jack, no.
You're a spoiled little brat, even.
But you're the most amazingly astounding, wonderful girl,...
let me try and get this out.
I'm not an idiot. I know how the world works.
I've got ten bucks in my pocket and I have nothing to offer you.
I can't turn away without knowing you'll be all right. That's all I want.
They've got you trapped, Rose, and you'll die if you don't break free.
Maybe not right away because you're strong, but...
...that fire that I love about you, Rose,...
It's not up to you to save me, Jack.
Tell Lucille about the disaster you had with the stationer's.
The invitations had to be sent back twice.
And the dreadful bridesmaids' gowns - what an odyssey that has been!
She knows I detest the colour, so she did it to spite me.
If only you'd come to me sooner.
Ruth saw some of my designs in ''la Mode Illustrée''.
They were for the Duchess of Marlborough’s youngest.
They were quite charming. But I think you'll agree, my dear,...
...together we've created something of a phoenix from the ashes!
- They said you might be... - Shh...
Now hold on to the railing.
- Keep your eyes closed. Don't peek. - I'm not.
â™ª Come, Josephine, on my flying machine,...
â™ª ...going up, she goes, up, she goes...
That was the last time Titanic ever saw daylight.
So we're up to dusk the night of the sinking.
Smith's standing there, the iceberg warning in his fucking hand,...
26 years of experience working against him.
He figures anything big enough to sink the ship they'll see in time to turn.
But the ship's too big with too small a rudder. Doesn't corner worth a damn.
It's quite proper, I assure you!
(French accent) I am not used to working in such...
- Do you know his work? - Of course!
look at his use of colour here!
Cal insists on carting this hideous thing everywhere.
Should we be expecting him any time soon?
Not as long as the cigars and brandy hold out.
Jack, I want you to draw me like one of your French girls...
...is another picture of me looking like a porcelain doll.
...I expect to get what I want.
Over on the bed... the couch.
Tell me when it looks right.
Put your arm back the way it was.
Put that other arm up... That hand right by your face.
Eyes to me. Keep them on me.
I believe you are blushing, Mr. Big Artiste.
I can't imagine Monsieur Monet blushing.
My heart was pounding the whole time.
It was the most erotic moment of my life.
You mean... did we do it?
Sorry to disappoint you, Mr. Bodine.
Will you put this back in the safe for me?
None of the stewards have seen her.
It's a ship. There's only so many places she could be.
I don't think I've ever seen such a flat calm.
It will make the bergs harder to see...
...with no breaking water at the base.
Maintain speed and heading, Mr. Lightoller.
Pretty tough for a valet, this fellow.
- Seems more like a cop. - I think he was.
What are you two doing here?
You shouldn’t be here! It's dangerous!
Don't mind us! You're doing a great job! Keep up the good work!
look what we have here, huh?
Put your hands on me, Jack.
You know, I can smell ice, you know... when it's near.
Did you ever find those binoculars?
Well, I'll be on my rounds. Cheerio.
Don't worry. I'll be all right.
Did you see those guys' faces?
I know! It doesn't make any sense.
Oh, yes... Here, look at this.
- look at that, would ya? - They're a bit warmer than we are.
Well, if that's what it takes for us to get warm, I'd rather not!
- Is there anyone there?! - Yes, what do you see?
It is, yes, sir, hard over!
Come on... come on... come on...
Come on, let’s go! They're closing the doors!
That was a close shave, weren't it?
Smell ice, can ya? Bleedin' Christ!
Note the time and enter it in the log.
I put her hard to starboard and ran the engines full astern...
...but it was too close. I tried to port round it, but she hit and...
- Close the watertight doors. - Doors are closed, sir.
Find the carpenter. Get him to sound the ship.
Come on, let’s get the hell out of here!
Why have the engines stopped? I felt a shudder.
I shouldn’t worry, madam. We've likely thrown a propeller blade.
- May I bring you anything? - No, thank you.
- Did you see anything? - I don't see anything now, do you?
If this is the direction the rats are going, that's good enough for me.
Please, sir, please... everything's under control.
- You there. - Sir, there is no emergency.
- I have been robbed. - Get the master-at-arms.
Hey, you're gonna miss the fun.
- Did you see what happened? - No. Apparently, it hit over there.
It's flooded eight feet and the mall hold is worse.
- Can you shore up? - Not unless the pumps get ahead.
- Have you seen the mall-hold damage? - No, she's already underwater.
We should tell Mother and Cal.
I think they're very good, sir.
Don't touch anything. I want the entire room photographed.
We've been looking for you, miss.
Indeed. Two things dear to me have disappeared this evening.
Now that one is back, I've an idea where to find the other. Search him.
- Take your coat off, sir. - Now what?
Cal, we're in the middle of an emergency.
- He couldn’t have. - Of course he could.
But I was with him the whole time.
Perhaps he did it while you were putting your clothes back on, dear.
Rose, they put it in my pocket.
- That was reported stolen. - I borrowed it. I was gonna return it.
- We have an honest thief, do we? - You know I didn't do this, Rose.
You know I didn't do it. You know I didn't do it, Rose!
Come on, son. There's a good lad.
You know I didn't do it! You know me!
Water... 14 feet above the keel in 10 minutes...
...in the forepeak, in all three holds and in boiler room six.
- When can we get under way, damn it! - That's five compartments!
She can stay afloat with the first four compartments breached, but not five.
As she goes down by the head...
...the water will spill over the bulkheads, from one to the next.
Back and back. There's no stopping it.
The pumps buy you time, but minutes only.
From this moment, no matter what we do,...
She's made of iron, sir. I assure you she can,...
And how many aboard, Mr. Murdoch?
Well, I believe you may get your headlines, Mr. Ismay.
Oh, it is a little slut, isn't it? look at me when I'm talking to you!
- Mr. Hockley? - Not now! We're busy!
Sir, please put on your lifebelt...
I'm sorry but it's Captain's orders. Now, please, dress warmly.
May I suggest topcoats and hats?
Not to worry, miss. I am sure it's just a precaution.
That's right. CQD. The distress call.
Tell whoever responds that we're going down by the head...
We moved them back inside. It's too damn cold and noisy for them.
Hey, sonny, what's doing? You got us all trussed up here...
- ...and now we're cooling our heels. - Sorry, ma'am. let me find out.
I don't think anybody knows what the hell's going on.
It's the goddamned English doing everything by the... book.
There's no need for language, Mr. Hockley.
Go and turn the heaters on in our rooms. I'd like a cup of tea when I return.
(Crewman) Would you put your lifebelt on, please?
I saw the iceberg, and I see it in your eyes.
Yes. In an hour or so...
...all this will be at the bottom of the Atlantic.
Tell only who you must. I don't want to be responsible for a panic.
And get to a boat quickly. Don't wait.
You remember what I told you about the boats?
Sir, they need you in the second-class purser's office. There's a mob up there.
- Go on. I'll keep an eye on him. - Aye. Right.
Sir! Carpathia says they're making 17 knots.
- She's the only one responding? - The only one close, sir.
They can be here in four hours.
We are swung out and ready, sir.
Hadn't we better get the women and children into the boats, sir?
Ladies and gentlemen, your attention, please!
Step this way, please! That's right.
For the time being I shall require only women and children.
...nice and cheery so there's no panic.
Lifebelts on! Put your Lifebelts on!
Here, put your lifebelt on. Here, come on...
It isn't time to go up to the boats yet.
look, please make sure you've got your Lifebelts on.
Women and children to the front.
When the first-class people are in the boats, they'll start with us...
Lower away! left and right together!
Right side only! Right side only!
Right side down! Lower away together!
You know, I do believe this ship may sink.
I've been asked to give you this small token of our appreciation.
Come on, sister, you heard the man. Into the boat.
- Any room for a gentleman, gentlemen? - Only women at this time, sir.
Will the lifeboats be seated according to class?
I hope they're not too crowded.
Oh, Mother... Shut up! Don't you understand?!
The water is freezing and there aren't enough boats! Not enough by half.
Half the people on this ship are going to die.
Come on, Ruth, get in the boat.
First-class seats are right up here.
It's a pity I didn't keep that drawing. It'll be worth more by morning.
(Crewman) Women and children towards the front.
(Molly) Come on, Rose, darling. There's plenty of room for you.
- Come on, Rose. You're next. - Come into the boat, Rose.
To be a whore to a gutter rat?!
I'd rather be his whore than your wife!
Help me! Can anybody hear me!
Madam, please, put on a lifebelt.
Lucy, for God's sake, put on your lifebelt. Set a good example.
Mr. Andrews, thank God! Where would they take someone under arrest?
You have to get to a boat right away.
I'm doing this with or without your help, but without will take longer.
Take the elevator to the very bottom. Go left down the crewmen's passage.
Go right and left again at the stairs. You’ll come to a corridor.
- (Crewman) The lifts are closed. - I do not care...
I'm sorry, miss, but the lifts are closed.
I'm through being polite, goddamn it! Now take me down!
Come on... Come on, come on...
Come back! I'm going back up!
- Lovejoy put it in my pocket. - I know! I know, I know, I know!
Rose, you have to find a spare key, all right?
It's a little silver one, Rose.
How did you find out I didn't do it?
I just realised I already knew.
You have to go find help.
Can anybody hear me! Please! Hello! Hello!
I need your help. There's a man back here and... Wait!
- Miss, you shouldn’t be here now. - Please, I need your help.
There is a man down here and he is trapped!
- No need to panic. - I'm not panicking!
You're going the wrong way! let go of me! Listen!
I guess we'll find out. Come on.
Good. Try to hit the same mark again, Rose. You can do it.
Come on, Rose. You can do it.
Listen, just hit it really hard and really fast.
Wait! Open your hands up a little more.
Oh, shit, this is cold! Oh, shit!
We have to find another way. Come on.
Put your backs into it! Pull!
Now there's something you don't see every day.
What's this luggage doing here? Get rid of it! We need the room!
Move along there. Make more room. That's right. look sharp.
- Lovejoy! - She's not on the starboard side.
We're running out of time and this martinet isn't letting any men on.
There's one on the other side letting men on.
Then that's our play. We’ll need some insurance first. Come on.
This way. All the way down here.
Here! What do you think you're doing?
You’ll have to pay for that! That's White Star line property!
Will you hold the boat a moment? I just have to run back to my room...
Mr. Lightoller, why are the boats being launched half full?
- Not now, Mr. Andrews. - 20 or so in a boat built for 65...
...and I saw one boat with only 12! 12!
We weren't sure of the weight, Mr. Andrews. These boats may buckle.
They were tested in Belfast with 70 men!
Now fill these boats, Mr. Lightoller, for God's sake, man!
I need more women and children, please!
(Crewman) Get back in there. This is not an exit.
- Get back in there. - This is not an exit!
You can't keep us locked in here! The ship's bloody sinking!
Get them back from those gates!
There are women and children down here!
let us up so we can have a chance!
- Can we get out? - It's hopeless that way!
Whatever we do, we've gotta do it fast.
- This whole place is flooding. - There is niente this way.
All right. let’s go this way. Come on.
No, come on. let’s go this way.
Go back to the main stairwell and everything will be sorted out there.
It will get sorted out back there.
Go back to the main stairwell.
- Open the gate now! - Go back down the main stairwell!
Goddamn it! Son of a bitch!
- Fabri, Tommy. Give me a hand here! - Move aside! Move aside!
You can't go up there! You can't do this!
Or I'll shoot you all like dogs!
- We're too late. - There are more boats at the front.
Stay with this one. Murdoch seems to be quite practical.
Stay back! Stay back, the lot of you! Stay back!
It's starting to fall apart. We don't have much time.
I'm a businessman, as you know, and I've a business proposition for you.
Colonel, are there any boats on that side?
No, miss, but there are a couple of boats all the way forward.
What's the use? Nobody's listening to us, anyway.
They don't Listen to us at dinner, either.
Come on, let’s play. Keep us warm.
(playing fast music from ''Orpheus In The Underworld'')
Music to drown by. Now I know I'm in first class!
- Where is everyone? - They're all still aft, sir.
We have an understanding, then, Mr. Murdoch?
Come through, madam. This way. Step back, sir.
You better check the other side.
(Murdoch) Any more women and children? Any children?
I found her on the other side waiting for a boat.
- Any more women and children? - They're all aboard.
Oh, goddamn it all to hell!
Sir! Sir, you can't go through here.
It'll be fine, darling. Don't you worry.
It's goodbye for a little while. Only a little while.
There's another boat for daddies. This one's for mummies and children.
Hold mummy's hand and be a good girl.
- I'm not going without you. - You have to... Now!
- Get in the boat, Rose. - No, Jack.
Yes, get on the boat, Rose.
My God, look at you. You look a fright!
- Go on. I'll get the next one. - No! Not without you!
I'll be fine. I'm a survivor, all right? Don't worry about me.
I have an arrangement with an officer on the ship.
Jack and I can get off safely.
- Got my own boat to catch. - Hurry!
(Crewman) Keep back. Keep back, I say!
There's no, uh... There's no arrangement, is there?
Not that you'll benefit much from it.
- Stop her! - What are you doing!
You're so stupid! Why'd you do that?
Why did you do that? Why?
It's all right. We’ll think of something.
I hope you enjoy your time together!
I put the diamond in the coat...
...and I put the coat on her!
It's the wrong way! Come back!
- Wait, sir! Open the gate, please! - Help us, please!
I'm sorry, I dropped the keys!
Don't leave! Please! Get more help!
I got 'em! Which one is it, Rose?
The sharp one, try the sharp one.
I got it! I got it! Go! Go, Rose!
Oars in place! Get an oar under it!
Women and children only, damn you!
Get these davits cranked in! Then get the falls hooked up!
Give us a chance to live, you limey bastard!
I'll shoot any man who tries to get past me!
We had a deal, damn you.
Your money can't save you any more than it can save me.
- I have a child! - Clear a path here!
Please, I'm all she has in the world.
Won't you even make a try for it?
I'm sorry that I didn't build you a stronger ship, young Rose.
Mr. Guggenheim... These are for you, Mr. Guggenheim.
We are dressed in our best and are prepared to go down as gentlemen.
But we would like a brandy.
Capitan, where should I go? Please...
And so they lived happily together for 300 years...
...in the land of Tir Na Nog.
land of eternal youth and beauty.
Cut those falls! Cut 'em! Cut 'em if you have to!
I need a knife! I need a knife!
Gentlemen, it has been a privilege playing with you tonight.
We have to stay on the ship as long as possible! Come on!
Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death...
You wanna walk a little faster through that valley?!
...pray for us sinners now and at the hour of our death. Amen.
I saw a new heaven and a new earth...
...when the first heaven and the first earth had passed away...
It'll be over soon. It'll all be over soon.
And he shall dwell with them and they shall be his people...
...and God himself shall be with them.
And God shall wipe away all the tears from their eyes.
And there shall be no more death.
Neither shall there be sorrow or crying.
Neither shall there be any more pain...
...for the former world has passed away.
(Crewman) Get those breakers in! Keep 'em in!
Give me your hand. I'll pull you over.
I've got you. I won't let go.
- What's happening, Jack? - I don't know!
The ship is gonna suck us down.
Take a deep breath when I say.
Kick for the surface and keep kicking.
Do not let go of my hand.
We're gonna make it, Rose. Trust me.
Get off her! Get off her!
Swim, Rose! I need you to swim!
The boats are coming back for us, Rose. Hold on just a bit longer.
They... had to row away from the suction...
- For God's sake! - Please! Help us!
You don't understand. If we go back, they'll swamp the boat!
- They'll pull us right down! - Knock it off. You're scaring me.
Come on, girls, grab an oar.
Are you mad?! We're in the middle of the North Atlantic!
Do you people want to live or do you want to die!
I don't understand a one of you.
- There's plenty of room for more. - There'll be one less on this boat...
...if you don't shut that hole in your face!
Bring in your oars over there. Tie these two boats together as well.
Now make sure that's tied up nice and tight.
Listen to me, men, we have to go back.
I want to transfer all the women from this boat into that boat.
It's just gonna take 'em a couple of minutes to get...
I don't know about you, but...
...I intend to write a strongly worded letter to the White Star line...
Don't you say your goodbyes. Not yet.
You're gonna get out of here.
You're gonna go on, and you're gonna make lots of babies,...
...an old lady warm in her bed.
Not this night. Not like this.
Winning that ticket was the best thing that ever happened to me.
You must do me this honour...
You must promise me that you'll survive,...
...and never let go of that promise.
I will never let go, Jack.
Is there anyone alive out there!
Is there anyone alive out there!
We’ll, keep checking them! Keep looking!
Is there anyone alive out there!
1,500 people went into the sea when Titanic sank from under us.
Six were saved from the water,...
...the 700 people in the boats had nothing to do but wait.
Wait to die, wait to live...
Sir, I don't think you'll find any of your people down here.
(Woman) His hair is reddish brown. Reddish brown and a white beard.
- Is there another passenger list? - There's no other list.
- Perhaps he's on another ship. - We're doing all we can, ma'am.
(Rose) That's the last time I ever saw him.

FormattedText.Content: {(Rose) That's the last time I ever saw him. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: He married, of course, and inherited his millions.

FormattedText.Content: {He married, of course, and inherited his millions. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: But the crash of '29 hit his interests hard...

FormattedText.Content: {But the crash of '29 hit his interests hard... Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: ...and he put a pistol in his mouth that year.

FormattedText.Content: {...and he put a pistol in his mouth that year. Properties: FontColor: default BackGroundColor: default isBold: No isItalic: Yes isUnderlined: No}

PlainText.PlainText: Can I take your name, please, love?
We never found anything on Jack. There's no record of him at all.
No, there wouldn’t be, would there?
And I've never spoken of him until now.
A woman's heart is a deep ocean of secrets.
But now you know there was a man named Jack Dawson...
In every way that a person can be saved.
I don't even have a picture of him.
He exists now only in my memory.
(Man) Keldysh, Keldysh, Mir 2 on our way to the surface.
(Brock) I was saving this for when I found the diamond.
Three years I've thought of nothing except Titanic...
â™ª Every night in my dreams...
â™ª That is how I know you go on.
â™ª You have come to show you go on.
â™ª I believe that the heart does go on.
â™ª ...and you're here in my heart,...
â™ª ...and my heart will go on and on.
â™ª love can touch just one time...
â™ª ...and never let go till we're gone.
â™ª love was when I loved you...
â™ª One true time I hold to...
â™ª In my life we'll always go on.
â™ª I believe that the heart does go on.
â™ª ...and you're here in my heart,...
â™ª ...and my heart will go on and on.
â™ª And I know that my heart will go on.
â™ª You are safe in my heart...
â™ª ...and my heart will go on and on.
